page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: {LANDSCAPE Aberdare is a small town situated in the Cynon Valley. The main river is the Cynon with tributaries Aman,Dare and Nant. These give their names to the villages Aberaman,Cwmaman,Abernant and the town itself. Aberdare is a close valley community. There used to be two railways in the valley but now the only line open is used to carry supplies to and from the Phurnacite Plant and neighbouring mines. Most of the housing and industries are situated on the valley bottom while the hillsides are mainly mixed woodland and enclosed farmland.
